page.title: 14BODDINGTON RESERVOIR
page.content: CONVENIENTLY PLACED BETWEEN THE 2 VILLAGES OF BODDINGON AND BYFIELD,THE RESERVOIR OFFERS THE COMMUNITIES A RECREN AREA .MOST PEOPLE LIKE THE RESERVOIR FOR WALKING ROUND AND A FEW WATCH,FISH OR GO BOATING.ON THE EAST BANK OF THE RESERVOIR IS THE CLUBHOUSE OF BANBURY SAILING CLUB.THE SAILING ACTIVITIES INCLUDE YACHTING AND WIND- SURFING.PERMITS ALLOW FISHERMEN TO TAKE PIKE,PERCH AND ROACH FORM THE WATERS. SOME PEOPLE THINK THAT THE 150 YEAR OLD RESERVOIR SHOULD BE IMPROVED,E.G. INSTALL TOILETS,FOOD KIOSKS,LITTER BINS CAR PARKS,ETC.SOME PEOPLE THINK THAT IT SHOULD BE LEFT AS IT IS THOUGH.THE RESERVOIR PROVIDES WATER FOR THE OXFORD CANAL AND IS OWNED BY THE WATERWAYS BOARD,WHO RECENTLY INSTALLED AUTOMATIC PUMPING AND REINFORCED THE DAM.
